subject: Economics
subcategory: Economic Crises That Shook the World
title: The Mississippi Bubble: France's Paper Money Disaster
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Mississippi Bubble: France's Paper Money Disaster.

hook.text: John Law convinced France to replace gold with paper money backed by Louisiana's riches.

buildup.text: Law's Mississippi Company monopolized French trade. Its shares rose 2,000% in 1719.

discovery.text: Law printed money to keep share prices rising. France's money supply increased 16-fold. Inflation exploded.

twist.text: When a prince tried to convert his shares to gold, the system collapsed. France banned paper money for 80 years.

climax.text: Law's experiment proved that paper money works only if people trust it â€” and trust can evaporate in a single afternoon.

punchline.text: France's first paper money experiment was so bad they didn't try again for 80.

quiz.question: What ultimately caused the Mississippi Bubble to burst?
options: Investors tried to convert shares to gold, revealing the system couldn't honor its promises
